title: How to Deal With Falling in Love with Your Best Friend (for Guys)

steps.title: Assess both of your personalities to see if they’re compatible.
steps.content: Assess both of your personalities to see if they’re compatible. You've likely seen your best friend in a relationship with someone else before. Is she flirty with other men even when they're not single or does she become all-consumed in a relationship with someone? Examine her (and your own) common traits when dating someone and see if you can handle this step-up in relation with her.

steps.title: Examine whether your lifestyles are compatible, too.
steps.content: Examine whether your lifestyles are compatible, too. Does she do things that completely irritate you (and vice versa)? If so, the chances of lasting in a long-term relationship will be affected. Annoying habits are easy to brush over for a few months before they become all you notice.

steps.title: Consider your abilities to compromise with her.
steps.content: Consider your abilities to compromise with her. There's way more give-and-take in a relationship than there is in a friendship. Can you truly accommodate each other's wants and needs? Can you do so maturely?

steps.title: Assess your ability to trust her in a romantic relationship.
steps.content: Assess your ability to trust her in a romantic relationship. If you're already best friends, you already know each other's secrets and some very personal information about one another. Can you trust your friend not to fall in love with someone else again or use that information against you if you break up?

steps.title: Examine whether your attraction is emotional, physical, or both.
steps.content: Examine whether your attraction is emotional, physical, or both. If the attraction is mostly physical, a fling may not be worth damaging such a close friendship over. If you don't want to risk the mental component of your relationship, look at finding a casual sex partner elsewhere.

steps.title: Test the waters to determine if she has the same feelings for you.
steps.content: Test the waters to determine if she has the same feelings for you. [1] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 5 November 2019. Remember, she might look at you as a brother figure and then be shocked when you tell her how you feel about her. This could ruin everything, but it could also make the relationship better. Weigh the risks against the possibilities. Be careful about coming out too suddenly or openly. No matter what you have to say, there's always a gentle way to say it.

steps.title: Take your time instead of telling her right away.
steps.content: Take your time instead of telling her right away. Drop subtle comments like, "You know, we've been friends for a long time," or "What would I do without you?" These are essentially harmless displays of affection toward her. However, don't drop them too often because you will risk being too obvious.

steps.title: Keep spending time with her to build your relationship.
steps.content: Keep spending time with her to build your relationship. Enjoy the same activities you always have as best friends. This helps show her that you're fun to be around.

steps.title: Use humor
steps.content: Use humor to get closer to her. If you both have a sense of humor, tell each other jokes you like. It serves to entertain you both (and if you're lucky, you may get emotionally closer before you even properly realize). If you have an inside joke, use it when it fits the situation.

steps.title: Understand what she needs and help her out.
steps.content: Understand what she needs and help her out. If she wants a shoulder to cry on, offer one. If she's cold, lend your jacket. Over time, she's bound to notice how great you are. You need to make sure she sees what a great boyfriend you would make and starts thinking about the idea herself. Remember to be there for her because you care about her, not because you expect anything in return.

steps.title: It can take time to build your connection, so be patient.
steps.content: It can take time to build your connection, so be patient . If you're lucky and compatible, things will work out. Most relationships are made long in advance and are just waiting to happen.

steps.title: Tell her how you feel.
steps.content: Tell her how you feel . [2] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 5 November 2019. This is often easier for a guy than a girl because most girls are pretty considerate of feelings. Give her a chance to understand you and when you think the time is right, tell her what you think. [3] X Expert Source Candice Mostisser Dating Coach Expert Interview. 24 January 2020. Of course, you may risk ruining and/or losing your friendship, or at least changing it even if you don't want to. But if it turns out lucky, then she will be even more considerate of you and your feelings. Don't break the news in an awkward, uncomfortable place where they won't have any escape route, like a party. [4] X Expert Source Candice Mostisser Dating Coach Expert Interview. 24 January 2020.

steps.title: If she doesn't end up liking you back, stay cool.
steps.content: If she doesn't end up liking you back, stay cool. Be prepared for an acceptance or a rejection after you confess your feelings. [5] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 5 November 2019. If she doesn’t feel the same, be casual and try not to let the friendship get awkward. Try to get things back to the way they were before. Your friend might also not have an immediate answer. Give them time to think things over with a clear head. [6] X Expert Source Candice Mostisser Dating Coach Expert Interview. 24 January 2020. Reader Poll: We asked 516 wikiHow readers, and 50% of them agreed that the best way to cope with changes in your friendship is to focus on your own interests and hobbies . [Take Poll] This can help you handle and move on from the rejection.
